required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study of Abiraterone Acetate Tablets (I) or ZYTIGA® in Patients With Metastatic Castration-resistant Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-Label, Multi-Center, Parallel Controlled Study Comparing the Serum Testosterone Levels in Patients With Metastatic Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer After Oral Administration of Abiraterone Acetate Tablets (I) or ZYTIGA®

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate whether the efficacy of the abiraterone acetate tablets (I) is comparable to that of the ZYTIGA®) by comparing the serum testosterone concentrations on Day 9 and/or Day 10 after oral administration of the two formulations in patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Abiraterone Acetate Tablets (I) compared with ZYTIGA®

primary_outcome.description: Blood Sample tested for Serum Testosterone Levels

secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects with total serum PSA level decreased by 50% from the baseline value.
The actual measured serum testosterone concentration.
The percentage of subjects with a serum testosterone concentration of ≤ 1 ng/dL
Defined as the plasma concentration of abiraterone
Defined as the steady-state maximum concentration
Defined as the area under the curve within the dosing interval at steady state
Defined as the steady-state minimum concentration
Defined as the mean blood drug concentration during the dosing interval at steady state
